name: Ijarah: Asset Ownership Verification
description: Verify that institution legally owns the asset before entering into Ijarah contract. Asset ownership by lessor is fundamental Shariah requirement for Ijarah validity

steps.title: Obtain Legal Title Documentation
steps.description: Acquire proof of legal ownership: title deed, purchase invoice, asset registration

requiredEvidence.description: Legal document proving institution's ownership of asset
Invoice showing institution purchased asset from supplier
For vehicles, real estate, etc. - government registration in institution's name
Bank transfer or payment receipt confirming institution paid for asset

policyConstraints.constraint: Institution must own the asset before leasing it - cannot lease asset it does not own

steps.title: Legal Verification of Ownership
steps.description: Legal counsel verifies that ownership documentation is valid and institution has clear title

requiredEvidence.description: Legal counsel's written opinion confirming valid ownership
For real estate - title search confirming no liens or encumbrances
Checklist confirming all ownership requirements met

policyConstraints.constraint: Clear legal ownership required - no disputes, liens, or unclear title

steps.title: SCO Ownership Confirmation
steps.description: Shariah Compliance Officer confirms ownership evidence meets Shariah requirements

requiredEvidence.description: SCO's confirmation that institution owns asset per Shariah standards

policyConstraints.constraint: Ownership must be verified before Ijarah contract can be executed

criticalNote: ⚠️ HARD GATE: Institution must own the asset before leasing. Without clear ownership, Ijarah contract is INVALID per AAOIFI SS-9 §3/1.
